item.title: Official Gameplay Reveal Trailer Indiana Jones and the Great Circle
item.description: Uncover one of history’s greatest mysteries in Indiana Jones and the Great Circle™, a first-person, single-player adventure set between the events of Raiders of the Lost Ark™ and The Last Crusade™. The year is 1937, sinister forces are scouring the globe for the secret to an ancient power connected to the Great Circle, and only one person can stop them - Indiana Jones™. You’ll become the legendary archaeologist in this cinematic action-adventure game from MachineGames, the award-winning studio behind the recent Wolfenstein series, and executive produced by Hall of Fame game designer Todd Howard

item.title: Black Myth: Wukong Mod Adds Darth Maul to the Game
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • One Black Myth: Wukong mod transforms the main character into Darth Maul.
  • The mods creator, NorskPL, also created a mod to transform the Destined One into Goku from Dragon Ball Z.
  • Released on August 19, Black Myth: Wukong has already sold over 10 million copies worldwide.

An impressive Black Myth: Wukong mod turns players into the dreaded Darth Maul of Star Wars fame, complete with his signature double-bladed lightsaber. Black Myth: Wukong has only been out for a week, but it has managed to sell over 10 million copies worldwide and helped boost Steam’s user count to an all-time high. Much of the game's praise stems from its combat and visuals, which draw inspiration from the classic Chinese novel Journey to the West .

A handful of interesting Black Myth: Wukong mods have already been released in the short time since the game’s successful drop, adding interesting new spins to the mythology-infused action RPG. One replaces the Destined One with Goku from Dragon Ball Z , a fitting change as both are directly inspired by Sun Wukong from Journey to the West . Before that, another Black Myth: Wukong mod turned the player’s bo-staff weapon into a double-bladed lightsaber from Star Wars.

Before creating the previously mentioned Goku and double-bladed lightsaber Black Myth: Wukong mods, NorskPL created a reskin of Darth Maul from Star Wars: Episode 1 - The Phantom Menace and posted it on NexusMods. When combined with NorskPL's later double-bladed lightsaber Black Myth mod, this allows players to hunt down Black Myth: Wukong ’s many challenging enemies and bosses as the infamous Sith Apprentice who famously struck down Qui-Gon Jin on Naboo before returning from the grave to seek his revenge during the Clone Wars.

New Black Myth Mod Turns Players into Darth Maul

Darth Maul himself is no stranger to the game world, as he has appeared in numerous titles since his big-screen debut in 1999, almost snagging a starring role in a Star Wars game before the project was canceled. Maul’s villainy has even spread beyond the confines of the Star Wars universe, as he has been featured as a playable skin in Fortnite. Elden Ring players have modeled their Tarnished after him on several occasions, and some Starfield players have even explored the cosmos in a recreation of his famous Scimitar spacecraft.

Thanks to the impressive work of NorskPL, players can now add Black Myth: Wukong to the list of video games invaded by the deadly Darth Maul, though Black Myth ’s brutal boss fights might be a tough task for even a powerful Dark Lord of the Sith. There are bound to be even more Black Myth: Wukong mods in the future, possibly adding other iconic Star Wars villains like Darth Vader, Kylo Ren, or even General Grievous.

item.title: Fortnite Fixes Doctor Doom's Monarch Pistol
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • The Monarch Pistol in Fortnite Chapter 5 Season 4 is back to its original powerful state after a recent nerf reversal by Epic Games.
  • Changes to the aiming down sights damage multiplier and fire rate make the pistol more powerful than before.
  • Doctor Doom drops the rarest variant of the Monarch Pistol, solidifying its position as the strongest handgun in the current season.

One of the most popular guns in the current season of Fortnite is finally back to its original state after developer Epic Games reverted a recent nerf it installed on the Monarch Pistol. The Monarch Pistol is the most powerful handgun in Fortnite currently, especially with its ultra-powerful mythical variant, which players can find by defeating Doctor Doom in the game.

Fortnite Chapter 5 Season 4 has proven a hit with fans due to the appearance of various popular Marvel characters like Doctor Doom, Mysterio, and War Machine, alongside a slew of new weapons and Marvel-themed items. Some of these items, however, like War Machine's Hover Jets and the Monarch Pistol, recently saw minor reworks in response to fan complaints about the items.

Now, however, as reported by ComicBook.com, Epic has reverted a recent change to the Monarch Pistol that increased its base damage but removed the damage boost players can attain while aiming down sights with the weapon. With the new changes, the pistol technically does less base damage, but with the 1.65 times damage multiplier while aiming finally back in play, its overall damage has still increased significantly.

The weapon also saw a major increase in its fire rate, which was lowered to 1.6 after the recent patch and is now seemingly back to its original number of 2.4, so the Monarch Pistol should be back on top when it comes to pistols this season. Of course, Fortnite has a few different levels of rarity for each weapon, all of which have different base stats, with the rarest variants being the most powerful.

Doctor Doom appears on the Fortnite island as an optional boss fight this season and drops the rarest variant of the Monarch Pistol when defeated, with his Mythical version doing the highest amount of damage of all. As such, the new reversions of previous changes will have the biggest effect on Doom's version of the Monarch Pistol, making it the strongest handgun in the game this season.

More changes are likely to come as time goes on, seeing as Epic is constantly reworking items to change up the meta in each season of Fortnite, but at least for now, the latest changes have put some things back to the way they were previously. There is no way of knowing what kinds of changes or new additions may come to the main game as of now, but with Fortnite OG Season 2 seemingly on the way, there will be no shortage of content to look forward to.

item.title: Xbox One Battle Royale Game Delisted
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Naraka: Bladepoint is no longer available on Xbox One. Players who want to keep playing must switch to Xbox Series X/S, PS5, or PC.
  • Transitioning players will receive prizes like Aeon Treasure, Spectral Silk, and XP bonuses.
  • Xbox Game Pass Ultimate subscribers get perks like the Aeon Bundle, which comes with items like an Epic Head Accessory.

Naraka: Bladepoint is no longer available for Xbox One players. While Naraka: Bladepoint can still be played on current-gen consoles and PC, Xbox One gamers must switch platforms to continue enjoying the popular battle royale.

Developed by 24 Entertainment and published by NetEase Games Montreal, Naraka: Bladepoint was originally released for PC in 2021. In 2022, Naraka: Bladepoint became available on Xbox One and Series X/S, with a PS5 release in July 2023. Pitting up to 60 players in battle royale matches and offering vast arsenals of melee and ranged attacks, Naraka: Bladepoint became a big success, selling over 6 million copies over time. However, the game’s stay on Xbox One was short-lived, as developer 24 Entertainment revealed back in June that Naraka: Bladepoint would be delisted from Xbox One on August 28.

Now, after being available on Xbox One for less than two years, Naraka: Bladepoint has been officially delisted and will no longer be supported on the platform. According to 24 Entertainment, this decision was made due to the technical limitations of the platform, as some new maps and events could not run properly on the last-gen console. Fortunately, players will retain access to their accounts, and can still play the popular battle royale game on Xbox Series X/S or PC.

What Are The Gifts for Naraka: Bladepoint Players Transitioning to Other Platforms?

  • 5 "Aeon Treasure."
  • 10 "Peerless Treasure Choice Gift."
  • 8 "Aeon Coin."
  • 300 "Hero Coin."
  • 5 "10x Treasure Bonus."
  • 5 "10x XP Bonus."
  • 5 "Score Keeper Card."
  • 2000 "Spectral Silk."
  • 3000 "Tae."

Players who transition to play on new platforms will gain some prizes, too, including 5 "Aeon Treasure," 10 "Peerless Treasure Choice Gift," 8 "Aeon Coin," 300 "Hero Coin," 5 "10x Treasure Bonus," 5 "10x XP Bonus," 5 "Score Keeper Card," 2000 "Spectral Silk, and 3000 "Tae." To be eligible for these prizes, however, gamers need to have created their account and logged on to Xbox One before June 26. The prizes will be available until October 30, and can only be claimed by logging on PC or Xbox Series X/S, so PS5 owners are out of luck.

The delisting of Naraka: Bladepoint for Xbox One does not mean that development for other platforms is slowing down. The new update released on August 28 also brings Lara Croft to Naraka: Bladepoint . Lara’s outfit will be added as a skin for Matari, the Silver Crow.

Also, Naraka: Bladepoint players who subscribe to Xbox Game Pass Ultimate currently have access to a special perk. Game Pass Ultimate subscribers can freely snatch Naraka: Bladepoint 's Aeon Bundle, which comes with a few goodies, such as the Epic Head Accessory for Lyam Liu, “Aureate Stamp,” as well as 10 Regular Treasure Choice Gifts, 600 Gold, and more.

item.title: Final Fantasy Moogle Tier List
item.description:
Quick Links

  • S Tier - The Cutest and Most Memorable Mascots
  • A Tier - Important and Unique Takes on Moogles
  • B Tier - Simple but Charming Moogles
  • C Tier - Moogles Ranging From Forgettable to Unsettling

The Final Fantasy series has depicted several distinct worlds with fully realized lore over the years, but there are a few consistent elements that have become staples across the games. Iconic features include magic element names, characters named Cid, and one especially recognizable recurring element, a cute mascot called Moogles, which has become a hallmark of Final Fantasy as a whole.

Moogles were first planned for Final Fantasy 2 before being cut. Making their official debut in 1990's FF3 before sitting out FF4 , they have since become a staple of the series after reappearing in FF5 . While they may not have appeared in FF10 or FF15 as proper characters, they were referenced in folklore, dolls, and costumes. The designs of Moogles have evolved alongside the aesthetic changes of the games, and some versions of the concept remain more fondly remembered than others.

S Tier - The Cutest and Most Memorable Mascots

Final Fantasy 6

This is when Moogles truly gained a significant role beyond just being cute creatures, as Final Fantasy 6 's Mog is the first playable example. This iteration also introduced the closed-eyes motif, a cute and defining feature which lives on in most other interpretations since.

Final Fantasy 9

On top of retaining their most iconic look, aside from looking more fuzzy, Moogles are straight-up central parts of this title, serving roles like save points and shopkeepers. While the Mog of this title isn't directly playable, her close connection to Eiko allows for a lot of representation.

A Tier - Important and Unique Takes on Moogles

Final Fantasy 12

In the world of Ivalice, Moogles were totally redesigned to resemble anthropomorphic rabbit people. This diverged heavily from previous versions, but their new lore stands as well-developed via memorable characters like Montblanc and the species' advanced technological skills.

Final Fantasy 14

With a streamlined Moogle design that leans into their chibi look, this MMO features deep lore integration with its take on them. With examples like its own Montblanc and even a Moogle mount, there's hardly a shortage of fan service for Moogle lovers here.

Final Fantasy 7

In the original release of Final Fantasy 7 , Moogles were memorable despite mostly appearing as toys and mascot figures, like FF7 's artificial Cait Sith. Minor changes like lacking pom-poms separate them, but this was more of an alternative representation of Moogles overall.

Final Fantasy 11

Moogles had important roles related to MMO mechanics in Final Fantasy 11 , like player housing, managing events, and weapon augmentation. The cute look was directly translated from the 2D games, made them a friendly sight in the game's impressive presentation at the time.

B Tier - Simple but Charming Moogles

Final Fantasy 13-2

After being largely absent in the first FF13 , a new version of Mog makes a major appearance as Serah's companion. There is a lot of charm throughout this updated design, mostly from its Mog Clock wand and the crystal pom-pom which allows it to float.

Final Fantasy 16

Though making a relatively small appearance with just one representative, Nektar of Final Fantasy 16 's Bounty Hunt Board, the sole Moogle of this title is an adorable questgiver who takes after the FF14 look.

Final Fantasy 5

Directly improving on their debut design in FF3 with more detail, this game also gave Moogles more lore and a greater role for the first time.

Dissidia Final Fantasy

The Moogles of this spin-off are based on their Kingdom Hearts appearance, a recognizable design featuring a large nose.

Final Fantasy 3

While the original appearance of Moogles lacked the refinement and detail that came later, it maintains a cute simplicity.

C Tier - Moogles Ranging From Forgettable to Unsettling

Final Fantasy Crystal Chronicles

With a chunkier, fuzzier look in these spin-off titles, which feature mini-games like Moogle Paint, these creatures are a memorable part of a lesser-known experience.

Final Fantasy 8

Minimog, the only Moogle in the title, had an unprecedentedly feline design. This discrepancy makes their sheer obscurity in-game seem unjustified.

Final Fantasy 7 Remake/Rebirth

The humanoid, koala-like Moogles in these games have not been received warmly. With other HD games managing to have cute versions of their own, the uncanny Moogles of Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth are easily the most unappealing of the franchise.
